clinical_study.brief_title: The Trauma of Betrayal: Treating Adjustment Disorder With Reconsolidation Blockade Under Propranolol
clinical_study.official_title: Treating Adjustment Disorders Stemming From Romantic Betrayals: An Open-label Trial of Impairing Memory Reconsolidation Using Propranolol

brief_summary.textblock: Attachment injuries are events occurring within couple relationships that involve betrayal or abandonment by a significant other during times of need (e.g., infidelity). They can be understood as relationship traumas, which can lead to debilitating symptoms consistent with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depression, and generalized anxiety for the injured partner. Research has demonstrated that the presence of an attachment injury represents a barrier to empirically effective couple's therapy. However, disrupting memory reconsolidation with the beta-blocker propranolol has been shown to alleviate PTSD symptoms by attenuating the salience of the emotional trauma memory, representing an interesting avenue for the treatment of adjustment disorders stemming from attachment injuries. Here, the investigators aim to extend the conditions under which reconsolidation therapy with propranolol can be used in a clinical setting. The investigators hypothesize that 6 sessions of memory reactivation under propranolol would significantly reduce trauma-related, depression, and anxiety symptom, associated with an attachment injury.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Repeated measures open-label clinical trial. After being included in the research study, participants are put on a 4 week waiting period prior to receiving 6 weekly sessions of memory reactivation under propranolol.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Impact of Events Scale-Revised Scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: Administered at baseline (V0), at the first treatment visit 5 weeks later (V1), at each subsequent weekly treatment visit (V2 - V6; once per week for 6 weeks), at the one-week post-treatment follow-up (V7), and at the three-month follow-up (V8).
primary_outcome.description: Severity of Trauma and Stressor-related symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Administered at baseline (V0), at the first treatment visit 5 weeks later (V1), at each subsequent weekly treatment visit (V2 - V6; once per week for 6 weeks), at the one-week post-treatment follow-up (V7), and at the three-month follow-up (V8).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline World Health Organization - Quality of Life BREF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Administered at baseline (V0), at the first treatment visit 5 weeks later (V1), at the one-week post-treatment follow-up (V7), and at the three-month follow-up (V8).
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived Quality of Life in 4 Domains, Psychological, Physical, Environmental, Social

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Clinical Global Impressions - Severity and Improvement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Administered at baseline (V0), at the first treatment visit 5 weeks later (V1), at each subsequent weekly treatment visit (V2 - V6; once per week for 6 weeks), at the one-week post-treatment follow-up (V7), and at the three-month follow-up (V8).
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician Administered assessment of symptom severity and improvement

intervention.description: 1mg/kg of propranolol 60 minutes prior to memory reactivation
